resources.string: \"The City becomes the dominant theme in political legends, but it is no longer a field of programmed and regulated operations. Beneath the discourses that ideologize the City, the ruses and combinations of powers that have no readable identity proliferate; without points where one can take hold of them, without rational transparency, they are impossible to administer.\"
- Michel De Certeau, \n The Practice Of Everyday Life
A Project By Jesse Scott | the memelab
Made with the support of Mobile Muse, The Banff Centre for the Arts, Tramploline, and DAIMON
